New Records: San Diego Padres tied a single-game MLB postseason record by hitting six home runs in their NLDS game against the Los Angeles Dodgers.
Key Match Events: Fernando Tatis Jr. was plunked by a Jack Flaherty fastball, sparking a heated exchange between Machado and Flaherty.
Fans in the left-field seats threw baseballs onto the field, causing a delay in play.
Jackson Merrill, Xander Bogaerts, David Peralta, and Kyle Higashioka also hit home runs during the game.
Pre-Game Insights: The Padres' manager, Mike Shildt, emphasized the importance of staying focused during the game.
Manny Machado called an impromptu meeting with the team before the eighth inning to keep them motivated.
Post-Match Reflections: Padres' players and manager expressed pride in the team's resilience and the significance of the win.
The victory was seen as a pivotal moment in their playoff push.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Padres held a two-run lead into the sixth inning before tensions flared.
San Diego's win marked their first road playoff victory since 2022.
Others: The game was tied 2-2 in the series, with the Padres winning their first game on the road in the NLDS since 2022.
Shohei Ohtani finished 0-for-4 with two strikeouts.
